meaning: extremely loud

adjective.definition: (of a person's voice) loud and powerful.
adjective.example: he introduced me to the staff with a stentorian announcement

meaning: mark of disgrace or inferiority

noun.definition: A mark of disgrace associated with a particular circumstance, quality, or person.
noun.example: the stigma of having gone to prison will always be with me

noun.definition: (in Christian tradition) marks corresponding to those left on Jesus’ body by the Crucifixion, said to have been impressed by divine favor on the bodies of St. Francis of Assisi and others.
A visible sign or characteristic of a disease.
(in a flower) the part of a pistil that receives the pollen during pollination.

meaning: to be sparing

verb.definition: Supply an ungenerous or inadequate amount of (something)

noun.definition: A person's fixed or allotted period of work.
noun.example: his varied career included a stint as a magician

noun.definition: Limitation of supply or effort.
noun.example: a collector with an eye for quality and the means to indulge it without stint

noun.definition: A small short-legged sandpiper of northern Eurasia and Alaska, with a brownish back and white underparts.

meaning: to specify as an essential condition

verb.definition: Demand or specify (a requirement), typically as part of a bargain or agreement.
verb.example: he stipulated certain conditions before their marriage

adjective.definition: (of a leaf or plant) having stipules.

meaning: having or showing little emotion

adjective.definition: (of a person) calm, dependable, and showing little emotion or animation.

meaning: arranged in layers

adjective.definition: Geology and Archaeology. Designating rock, sediment, remains, etc., that show stratification or are deposited in strata. Also, of a fossil or artefact: used to date a stratum, or identified as belonging to a particular stratum.
Chiefly Biology and Medicine. Designating a tissue or substance that has a layered structure, or is composed of layers with differing properties.
Botany. Of seeds: subjected to treatment by stratification for the purpose of preserving them, or (typically) to promote germination.
Of a volume of gas (especially the atmosphere) or of liquid (especially a body of water): exhibiting stratification.
Electricity. Of an electrical discharge in a tube or column of rarefied gas: exhibiting a series of luminous striations separated by dark regions.
Of a society or culture: divided into levels or classes based on social status, education, or income.

Statistics. Designating a method of sampling in which a sample from a heterogeneous population is obtained by dividing the population into homogeneous subgroups and taking a sample from each, or a population sample obtained by this method.

meaning: marked with thin; narrow grooves or channels;

adjective.definition: Marked with striae.

meaning: something that restrains; negative criticism;

noun.definition: A restriction on a person or activity.
A sternly critical or censorious remark or instruction.
noun.example: his strictures on their lack of civic virtue

noun.definition: Abnormal narrowing of a canal or duct in the body.

meaning: loud; harsh; unpleasantly noisy

adjective.definition: Loud and harsh; grating.
adjective.example: his voice had become increasingly sharp, almost strident

meaning: to swagger; display to impress others;

noun.definition: A rod or bar forming part of a framework and designed to resist compression.
A stiff, erect, and apparently arrogant or conceited gait.
noun.example: that old confident strut and swagger has returned

verb.definition: Walk with a stiff, erect, and apparently arrogant or conceited gait.
Brace (something) with a strut or struts.
verb.example: the holes were close-boarded and strutted

meaning: to impair or reduce to uselessness

verb.definition: Cause to lose enthusiasm and initiative, especially as a result of a tedious or restrictive routine.
verb.example: the mentally stultifying effects of a disadvantaged home

verb.definition: Cause (someone) to appear foolish or absurd.
verb.example: Counsel is not expected to stultify himself in an attempt to advance his client's interests

meaning: to dull the senses of; stun; atonish

verb.definition: Make (someone) unable to think or feel properly.
verb.example: the offense of administering drugs to a woman with intent to stupefy her

meaning: dark and gloomy; hellish;

adjective.definition: Relating to the Styx River.

meaning: notice ordering someone to appear in court

noun.definition: A writ ordering a person to attend a court.
noun.example: a subpoena may be issued to compel their attendance

verb.example: the Queen is above the law and cannot be subpoenaed

meaning: to settle down; grow quiet;

verb.definition: Become less intense, violent, or severe.
verb.example: I'll wait a few minutes until the storm subsides

verb.definition: (of water) go down to a lower or the normal level.
verb.example: the floods subside almost as quickly as they arise

meaning: to support with proof or evidence

verb.definition: Provide evidence to support or prove the truth of.
verb.example: they had found nothing to substantiate the allegations

meaning: essential

adjective.definition: Having a firm basis in reality and therefore important, meaningful, or considerable.
adjective.example: there is no substantive evidence for the efficacy of these drugs

adjective.definition: Having a separate and independent existence.
(of law) defining rights and duties as opposed to giving the rules by which such things are established.
(of a dye) not needing a mordant.

noun.definition: A noun.

meaning: to include; incorporate;

verb.definition: Include or absorb (something) in something else.
verb.example: most of these phenomena can be subsumed under two broad categories

meaning: intended to undermine or underthrow; especially an established government;

adjective.definition: Seeking or intended to subvert an established system or institution.

noun.definition: A subversive person.

meaning: relief; help in time of distress or want;

noun.definition: Assistance and support in times of hardship and distress.

verb.example: prisoners of war were liberated and succored

meaning: the right to vote

noun.definition: The right to vote in political elections.
A series of intercessory prayers or petitions.

meaning: various

adjective.definition: Of various kinds; several.

plural noun.definition: Various items not important enough to be mentioned individually.
plural noun.example: a drugstore selling magazines, newspapers, and sundries

meaning: to relace; especially to displace as inferior or antiquated;

verb.definition: Take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use); supplant.
verb.example: the older models have now been superseded

meaning: lying in the back; marked by lethargy;

adjective.definition: (of a person) lying face upward.
Failing to act or protest as a result of moral weakness or indolence.
adjective.example: supine in the face of racial injustice

noun.definition: A Latin verbal noun used only in the accusative and ablative cases, especially to denote purpose (e.g., dictu in mirabile dictu “wonderful to relate”).

meaning: to replace; substitute;

verb.example: another discovery could supplant the original finding

meaning: beseeching

noun.definition: A person making a humble plea to someone in power or authority.

adjective.definition: Making or expressing a plea, especially to someone in power or authority.

meaning: one who asks humbly and earnestly

adjective.definition: Making or expressing a plea, especially to someone in power or authority.
adjective.example: a supplicant serf before an ill-tempered monarch

noun.definition: A person making a humble or earnest plea to someone in power or authority.
noun.example: we are equals and not supplicants begging for work

meaning: the act of assuming to be true or real

noun.definition: An uncertain belief.
noun.example: they were working on the supposition that his death was murder

meaning: a form of deductive reasoning with a major premise; a minor premise; and a conclusion

noun.definition: An instance of a form of reasoning in which a conclusion is drawn (whether validly or not) from two given or assumed propositions (premises), each of which shares a term with the conclusion, and shares a common or middle term not present in the conclusion (e.g., all dogs are animals; all animals have four legs; therefore all dogs have four legs).

meaning: related to the woods or forest

adjective.definition: Consisting of or associated with woods; wooded.
adjective.example: trees and contours all add to a sylvan setting
